pages.subdeck: Jailed ... twisted killer Daniel Bartlam
pages.headline: Killer obsessed by soap violence
pages.teaser: LAD of 14 battered his mother’s face with hammer then set body alight
pages.articlebody:
A BOY of 14 who beat his mum to death in a hammer attack copied from Coronation Street was locked up for a minimum of 16 years yesterday.

Daniel Bartlam repeatedly battered Jacquelineâs face and head before setting her body alight.

Schoolboy Bartlam, now 15, was obsessed with TV soap murder plots and grisly horror movies.

He kept video clips on his computer of violent scenes from Coronation Street, Hollyoaks, Emmerdale, TV drama Trial And Retribution and torture film Saw.

His favourites included a Corrie scene in which serial killer John Stape murdered a woman with a hammer before hiding her body.

Bartlam also studied websites with titles such as How To Get Away With Murder.

And four days before killing devoted mum Jacqueline, he wrote a soap script about âDanielâ murdering a woman named âJackieâ with a hammer.

In his story, the killer made the crime look like a break-in and then started a fire to cover his tracks.

It was a plotline Bartlam followed closely as he turned fantasy into grim reality.

First he attacked Jacqueline, 47, with a claw hammer at their detached home in Redhill, Nottingham â striking her repeatedly on the skull and face.

Then he packed her body with paper and doused it with petrol. Finally, he set both body and house alight.

Police and firemen arrived to find Bartlam and brother Dominic, six, standing outside.

He told officers he woke to find a masked intruder in the house. The man had hurled a hammer at him then fled.

Bartlam said he then found his mumâs blood-covered body and realised the house was ablaze.

He claimed he grabbed his brother and their dog and fled.

But a search of Bartlamâs bedroom revealed a disturbing drawing of a woman who had two knives rammed into eyes â with the words: âDie bitch.â

There were also notebooks of ravings on sex abuse and death.

And his computer had the violent clips from soap and films along with a record of his visits to murder websites.

Experts also recovered the script he had deleted â a chillingly accurate account of the murder. It included a description of a hammer attack, a fake break-in alibi, a fire â and even the rescue of a younger brother. They also found cleaning fluid â suggesting an attempt to eliminate evidence.

During initial interviews Bartlam stuck to his story.

He claimed he last saw his mum alive the night before her death when she left some clothes in his bedroom.

But a neighbour reported being woken at 1am by her and Bartlam arguing violently.

Bartlam finally blurted out the truth while on remand. After a row with a female resident at a care centre, he told an officer: âI could kill her, just like I killed my mum.â

Bartlam then changed his story. He admitted killing divorcee Jacqueline â but insisted it was manslaughter, not murder.

He said he had gone berserk as they rowed about a pair of lost trainers. Bartlam claimed he struck out after she taunted him for being âa f****** freak.â He insisted he had been a victim of years of âinappropriate parentingâ. But at his trial the jury refused to believe his story and found him guilty of murder.

Yesterday Nottingham Crown Court judge Mr Justice Flaux sentenced Bartlam to life with a minimum of 16 years.

He said the public schoolboy carried out a âgrotesque and senseless killing.â

During Bartlamâs trial the jury heard of his fascination with the Corrie character John Stape, who killed three people. One of Stapeâs victims was teacher Charlotte Hoyle â who he hit over the head with a hammer.

The court was also told that in 2010 Bartlam was referred to a school counsellor after behaving bizarrely in class.

He told the counsellor he heard voices urging him to hurt people who had upset him. Bartlam also told of visions of killing people with a knife.

But six weeks before he murdered his mum, health assessors said he showed no sign of mental illness and was not a danger to others. After yesterdayâs verdict Detective Chief Inspector Kate Meynell said: âThe boy planned and carried out what he thought was the perfect murder.

âMaybe one day he may explain what happened. The whole thing has been chilling. He spoke in court about what he did without any remorse.â

Jacquelineâs parents said in a statement: âDaniel attempted to make out during the trial that Jacqui was a bad mother, which couldnât be further from the truth. She loved her boys.

âThere are no winners here because not only have we lost Jacqui, but we have lost Daniel too.

"The most difficult part for us â and something that only Daniel can answer â is: Why?â

ITV yesterday said: âITV takes careful steps to ensure that pre-watershed drama is appropriate for a family audience and the Stape murder scenes in Coronation Street were fully compliant.â

a.parker@the-sun.co.uk



myView

By Dr DAVID HOLMES, Criminal Psychologist

CHILDREN learn violence from TV but generally do not act on it.

A small minority, however, do not have the same restraint that holds most of us back.

It can be caused by something missing in their biology or chemistry. The fact this was planned, could mean this boy is a fledgling psychopath.

DANIEL Bartlam, who murdered his mum, speaks in clip he posted

pages.subdeck: Fit for a Prince ... Cheryl Cole arrives at LA airport
pages.headline: Cheryl: I dream I marry Harry
pages.teaser: FORMER X Factor judge has revealed she has the hots for the Prince — and says she knows he fancies her too
pages.byline: By LEIGH HOLMWOOD, Deputy TV Editor
pages.articlebody:
SINGER Cheryl Cole has revealed she dreams of being a princess and marrying Prince Harry.

The former X Factor judge, 28, said she knows Harry has a crush on her â and admitted she âlovesâ him too.

The Prince told of his feelings for Cheryl at The Sunâs Millie awards in 2009, when he told the ITV show winner Joe McElderry he was âso jealous that you got to spend weeks with Cherylâ.

The Girls Aloud star, who set up a charity alongside Prince Charles last year, was asked by a fan if she knew the 27-year-old âfanciedâ her.

She replied: âI do! I love Prince Harry. Actually, I had a dream last night I married Prince Harry and was a real-life princess.

"Itâs true. And Charles was my father-in-law instead of my charity partner!â

Her comments in a Q&A session for Marie Claire magazine were not the first time Cheryl has told of her feelings for Harry.

Last year she spoke of her liking for âfunny, down-to-earthâ Charles â but said: âHarryâs my favourite. Heâs relateable to â one of us, but royal, and with a posh voice.â

Cheryl gave Harry something to think about when she was snapped in Los Angeles showing off her toned legs in tiny shorts. Her marriage to love-rat footballer Ashley Cole ended in divorce in 2010.

Harry split from Chelsy Davy in 2010 and has since been linked to a string of beauties.

l.holmwood@the-sun.co.uk

pages.subdeck: ANTON DECKED ... Manchester United star Antonio Valencia celebrates his late goal
pages.headline: Antonio answers Fergie’s prayers
pages.teaser: MANCHESTER UNITED said Vallelujah last night as they went five points clear at the top
pages.articlebody:
MANCHESTER UNITED said Vallelujah last night as they went five points clear at the top of the Premier League.

Two thunderbolts in the last 10 minutes from Antonio Valencia and sub Ashley Young finally broke brave Blackburnâs resistance.

Valencia admitted it was â50-50â whether his ferocious 81st-minute right-foot strike was a shot or cross.

But boss Alex Ferguson did not care. It answered his prayers for victory and means even more of a squeaky bum time for Manchester City rival Roberto Mancini.

Delighted Fergie said: âThe goals came so late, which typifies the clubâs history.

"Coming when it did, the Antonio Valencia goal was very important.

"If you donât try to shoot youâll never find out if you can score. It had great power.â

Manciniâs men could be eight points in arrears by the time they face Arsenal on Sunday afternoon if United see off QPR earlier in the day.

Ferguson added: âIt is vital that we win that game. We are also helped by having made up the goals deficit on City. I think it was 18 at one time.â

Young, who scored from 20 yards with five minutes to go, said: âTo get that first goal, whether it was a shot or a cross, delighted us and Iâd put my goal up there with my best.â

Steve Keanâs Rovers fought a battling rearguard action but finally bowed to the pressure they were put under and fall into the bottom three on goal difference.

Kean said: âIâm frustrated and disappointed. It was a game that could have gone either way.

âTheir keeper had a great night but you have to take your chances.

"If we can play like that for 90 minutes in our remaining games, we will beat any of the teams we still have to face.â

Even Fergie admitted United owed a debt to keeper David de Gea for some of his saves on rare Blackburn breaks.

He said: âDe Geaâs progress is clear. He has always had great ability and kept us in the game here so we could go on and get those goals.â

pages.subdeck: Split ... Ronan Keating and Yvonne
pages.headline: Ronan Keating: My life goes on
pages.teaser: HEARTBROKEN Boyzone star opens his heart about his split after 14 years of marriage
pages.byline: By JENNY McCUDDEN and AOIFE FINNERAN
pages.articlebody:
HEARTBROKEN Ronan Keating spoke to The Sun about his marriage split yesterday â and insisted: âLife goes on.â

The millionaire pop star, 35, revealed that his feelings for wife Yvonne have not changed despite the coupleâs harrowing break-up.

And he admitted they had faced a gruelling time since the sad news became public.

Speaking at a Dublin charity bash, Boyzone singer Ronan said: âIt was a very hard weekend for us, given my personal circumstances.â

âWe are getting on with our life as best that we can. And thatâs why Iâm here today, just trying to get on with things. Life goes on.â

He confirmed the end of his 14-year relationship with Yvonne, 37, but added: âWe are great. I still love her.â

Ronan was attending an event in aid of autism to support band pal Keith Duffy.

Keith, whose 12-year-old daughter is autistic, said: âRonan is going through a very difficult time. For him to show up today just goes to show what a friend he is.â

After the bash, Ronan set off home on his beloved Harley-Davidson, arriving half an hour later at his familyâs mansion in Malahide.

The Sun revealed on Sunday how the pair had called time on their marriage. Ronanâs secret affair with a dancer was exposed in 2010.

Yvonne, mum to kids Jack, 13, Missy, 11 and six-year-old Ali, was at one point seen driving from the house.

pages.subdeck: Approach ... patrolman walks up to car
pages.headline: Raidside assistance
pages.teaser: MAN held after being filmed taking wheels from a car & replacing them with bald tyres
pages.articlebody:
AN RAC patrolman was under arrest yesterday after being filmed stealing wheels from a car â and replacing them with an old set with bald tyres.

The rogue repairman took them from a Peugeot 206 belonging to Colin Dann at around 2.30am.

But he put the replacement wheels back on with TWO bolts instead of four making the vehicle a death trap.

Lorry driver Colin, 40, said: âI got in the car to drive to work and it didnât feel right. I thought Iâd better pump up the tyres and then realised they were not my tyres.

"Theyâre almost bald. I took the hub caps off and noticed there were only two bolts.â

Colin then remembered a nearby shop in Rainham, East London, has two CCTV cameras, and asked the owner if he could see the footage.

It showed the RAC van pulling up. The patrolman pokes his head around the corner to make sure no one is watching before starting to replace the front wheels. The switch takes ten minutes.

Colin said: âThe tyres he put on are illegal â and I drove down the A13 at 50mph on them.

âIf the wheels had come off it would have caused an accident or even a death.â

RAC vans are fitted with tracking devices which log movements and police confirmed a 32-year-old had been arrested. He has been suspended by the RAC.

g.oshea@the-sun.co.uk

video.caption: DRIVER seen on tape as he takes wheels from a car in the middle of the night

nibs.headline: BGT star Kris Evans: I was treated rap
nibs.teaser: THE MEND singer Kris Evans has told how cruel bullies branded him a deluded loser
nibs.articlebody:
THE MEND star Kris Evans has told how bullies branded him a deluded loser for trying to rap when he was WHITE.

They laughed at him for âtrying to be like Eminemâ.

Kris wowed the Britainâs Got Talent judges with his version for Sittinâ On (The Dock Of The Bay) on Saturday night with his band.

Simon Cowell said they had great chemistry and is already predicting big things for the four-piece.

Kris told TV Biz he hoped their new found success would help him prove the haters wrong. He said: âI grew up in Middleton (Manchester) in an average working class family. Iâve had a lot of negative things because Iâm a white guy and Iâm rapping.

âThe music Iâm doing is classed as a black genre so people didnât believe anything would come of it. People would say I was an Eminem wannabe, but it went in one ear and out the other.

âThey said it was unrealistic. But I believe if you want something then youâve got to do it.â

He added he had been trying to crack the big time for years and even handed out his rap CDs to people on the streets of Manchester in an attempt to get noticed.

Despite getting the flick from The X Factor over a contract dispute, the âtime was rightâ for The Mend.

Kris said: âItâs the perfect time for us. A lot of people are now coming up north and with us being from Manchester it feels right.

âWe hardly sleep. Weâre always in the studio and working hard. I hope Britainâs Got Talent can make it work for us.â

nibs.headline: Kelly Brook: I’m ready for a baby
nibs.teaser: BRAVE model says her tragic miscarriage last May was the ‘hardest lesson’ and made her change her lifestyle
nibs.articlebody:
KELLY Brook says she is ready to try again for a baby â after revealing her miscarriage last May was the âhardest lessonâ.

The model said the heartache she suffered with boyfriend Thom Evans while five months pregnant made her change her lifestyle.

Kelly, 32, explained: âBefore I fell pregnant, Iâd been living the life of a 22-year-old â going to clubs and flying to a different country every two weeks.

âWhen I fell pregnant, I thought I could do what I wanted, but my body let me know that wasnât the case. When I miscarried, I was devastated.â

Kelly added: âIt was the hardest lesson but, ultimately, a good one.

âSince the miscarriage, Iâve changed dramatically. Iâve reduced my workload, Iâm eating more healthily and exercising more.â

Kelly, who has just celebrated ex-rugby player Thomâs 27th birthday in New York, thinks it could be time for another go at motherhood.

She hinted: âI donât want to leave it much longer. If I fell pregnant, Iâd feel ready.â

nibs.headline: Titanic viewers jump ship
nibs.teaser: ITV’S lavish drama sinks in the ratings as three million people turn off in protest at show’s unsympathetic characters
nibs.articlebody:
MILLIONS of Titanic viewers have jumped ship.

ITV spent a huge Â£11million on just FOUR episodes of the lavish drama and pulled in a decent 7.3millon viewers for the first episode.

But almost 3million turned off for last Sundayâs second episode after viewers criticised the showâs lack of emotion and unsympathetic characters.

It was walloped by rival BBC Sunday night drama Silent Witness, which attracted 6.7million.

The fall in numbers is a huge blow for ITV, which had high hopes for the show after signing up Downton Abbey writer Julian Fellowes.

A source said: âITV beancounters will be shaking their heads at these figures.â

pages.subdeck: 'It means so much' ... Tom Cooper and Tammy Dale
pages.headline: Facebook pals pay for wedding
pages.teaser: A TERMINALLY-ill dad will celebrate his dream wedding after pals raised £20k in 4wks
pages.byline: By GUY PATRICK and ANDREW CHAMBERLAIN
pages.articlebody:
A TERMINALLY-ill dad will celebrate his dream wedding tomorrow â after Facebook members organised his Â£20,000 big day FREE.

The ceremony was sorted in less than four weeks after cancer-stricken Tom Cooper announced his aim to wed lover Tammy Dale.

The pair planned the bash to give their two little girls lasting memories of the happiest day of their lives.

But they had to invite donations on Facebook after 25-year-old Tomâs deteriorating health saw him give up his job as a maintenance worker.

Tammy, 23, then quit as a nail technician to become his full-time carer.

Within days of their appeal, caring friends, family, local businesses and even total strangers had rallied to their aid.

And last night they told how they had been given a free wedding venue and reception, plus gifts including limos, suits, a horse and carriage, photography, flowers and a wedding cake.

Tammy was also able to choose her dream dress after a shop owner allowed her the pick of her collection.

Around 100 family and friends will attend the coupleâs big day in Burnley, Lancs.

Tom, whose throat cancer has spread, said: âWe couldnât believe it. The offers just kept coming.â Tammy, mum to girls Tienna, four, and Ziani, 20 months, said: âWe canât thank everyone enough. It means so much.â

g.patrick@the-sun.co.uk

pages.subdeck: Arrests ... pair were held by Northamptonshire Police officers after baby boy's death
pages.headline: Pair held on suspicion of murdering seven-week-old baby boy
pages.teaser: A MAN and a woman have been arrested on suspicion of the murder of a seven-week-old boy
pages.articlebody:
A MAN and a woman have been arrested on suspicion of the murder of a seven-week-old baby boy.

The pair, aged 23 and 20, were held following the death of little Jamie Kightley, of Far Cotton, Northampton, last month.

A spokeswoman for Northamptonshire Police said the youngster died on Saturday, March 17.

Initial findings suggest he died as a result of a head injury, but tests are ongoing.

The two people arrested in connection with his death have been bailed pending further inquiries.

The force spokeswoman said: âWe can confirm that two arrests have been made by officers in the East Midlands special operations unit for major crime.

âA 23-year-old man and a 20-year-old woman, both from Northampton, were arrested on suspicion of the murder of a seven-week old baby.â

The arrests were made on March 22.

An inquest is due to be opened and adjourned tomorrow into the circumstances of the death.

image.caption: Arrests ... pair were held by Northamptonshire Police officers after baby boy's death

pages.subdeck: Jailed ... Reverend Brian Shipsides presided over 250 sham marriages
pages.headline: Vicar jailed over sham marriage scam
pages.teaser: VICAR jailed for presiding over nearly 250 sham marriages in a ‘massive and systematic’ immigration fraud
pages.articlebody:
A CHURCH of England vicar was jailed for four-and-a-half years today for presiding over nearly 250 sham marriages in a âmassive and systematicâ immigration fraud.

The Rev Brian Shipsides, 56, conducted more than 200 bogus unions at his inner-city parish, pocketing the proceeds for his own financial gain.

The nuptials — largely between Nigerians and European Union citizens — gave the phoney brides and grooms the right to stay in Britain.

Inner London Crown Court heard that Shipsidesâ scam centred around All Saints Church in Forest Gate, East London, where he held around 250 ceremonies in a two-and-a-half year period.

The unions were arranged with the help of âmarriage fixerâ Amudalat Ladipo, 32, and in many cases, involved the purchase of easyJet flights for those flown into the country specifically for the wedding ceremonies.

Prosecutors claim Shipsides pocketed more than Â£30,000 for his âmeticulously planned and carefully orchestratedâ scheme.

Shipsides had been parish priest at the church for 13 years and is in the Guinness Book of Records for officiating the marriage of the worldâs tallest couple in 2001.

Jailing Shipsides, Judge Peter Grobel told him: âYour important role in this conspiracy was a disgraceful abuse of your calling as an ordained minister of the Church.

âThis was a conspiracy to breach the United Kingdomâs immigration laws by arranging sham marriages.

âThese marriages took place in your church. Your church where you had been the priest in charge for many years.â

During Shipsidesâ tenure, he said up to seven bogus unions took place on one day.

The judge added: âYour criminal conduct appears to have been motivated as much by arrogance as by greed.

âThere really is no mitigation in respect of this type of offending which undermines UK immigration law, threatens the benefit system and exploits the lives of many vulnerable and desperate people.â

image.caption: Jailed ... Reverend Brian Shipsides presided over 250 sham marriages

pages.subdeck: Grisly ... cops pass covered bodies
pages.headline: Gunman kills 7 in US uni rampage
pages.teaser: LOCAL news reports two people were shot in the head and at least six wounded
pages.articlebody:
AT least seven people were killed and three injured yesterday after a crazed gunman opened fire at a US university.

The shooter is said to have stood up in a class at the Christian college and blasted one victim at point blank range before firing off about 30 shots.

Cops described him as Asian with a heavy build and wearing khaki clothes.

He was caught at the car park of a shopping centre where his relatives work about two hours after the attack, which started at around 10.30am local time.

One witness said he was cuffed and taken away in a car.

Police later identified the suspect as 43-year-old One L Goh.

Pastor Jong Kim, who founded Oikos University in Oakland, California, a decade ago, said the killer had been a nursing student but was no longer enrolled.

Armed police, including SWAT teams, surrounded the site as officers smashed doors with hammers and stormed the building.

Television images showed cops evacuating students.

Four bodies lay outside the school covered by sheets while rescue workers removed at least four more on stretchers.

One witness said last night: âHe stood up in the class and just started firing.

âHe shot one guy in the chest, shot another person, and just started firing like crazy.â Local resident Angie Johnson, 52, saw a young woman leaving the building with âa hole in her arm the size of a coinâ, who was crying: âIâve been shot.â

Ms Johnson said the woman told her the killer was a man in her nursing class.

She added: âShe said he looked crazy all the time â but they never knew how far he would go.â

Police spokeswoman Johnna Watson last night said the situation remained âvery tenseâ. She added: âWe are interviewing witnesses to try to determine if this person is known to them.â

Stunned councillor Larry Reid spoke of the communityâs grief, saying: âThere are seven families that are having to deal with this horrendous act.â

Oikos is popular with Catholic Korean students. Its courses include bible studies, but is not accredited by the government.

Its website states: âStudents are given a Christian education based on solid Christian doctrine.

âOur main goal is to foster spiritual Christian leaders.â

p.samson@the-sun.co.uk

video.caption: AT least seven killed and others injured in shooting at California college

image.caption: Grisly ... cops pass covered bodies

pages.subdeck: Love on the cards ... keepers hope Yang Guang will mate with lucky lady Tian Tina (right)
pages.headline: If zoo's tunnel of love's rockin' don't come knockin'
pages.teaser: CAMERAS at zoo turned off to give PANDAS some privacy amid hopes they will mate
pages.articlebody:
ZOO bosses were forced to turn the cameras off in a specially built tunnel of love today as the only pandas in Britain got jiggy with it.

Keepers brought the pair together after judging the female was ready to mate.

Yang Guang was allowed to meet up with lucky lady Tian Tina after tests showed she had ovulated — a rare event for a panda.

It happens only once a year meaning keepers had to play matchmakers pretty quick if they were going to be successful.

They actually only have a window of 36 hours in which Tian Tina can fall pregnant.

Edinburgh Zoo has turned off the "pandacam" which allows people to watch the animals online to give them some privacy.

A spokesman said: "The love tunnel is being opened and the bears will be able to meet each other that way. Today is the first time they have been introduced to each other."

Giant pandas Tian Tian — meaning Sweetie in English — and Yang Guang — meaning Sunshine — arrived in Scotland from Ya'an reserve in Chengdu, China, in December.

Earlier this month the zoo said it might stream any birth live on the internet.

Iain Valentine, director of research and conservation at the zoo, said last week: "We are hopeful of a positive outcome.

âHowever, we are realistic that this is only the very first year that Tian Tian and Yang Guang have been in Scotland and that we also have ten more to go.â

It may be hard to tell even if she does get pregnant because pandas sometimes have ghost pregnancies where their behaviour and hormones indicate they are expecting when they are not.

image.caption: Love on the cards ... keepers hope Yang Guang will mate with lucky lady Tian Tina (right)

pages.subdeck: Blazing row ... Boris Johnson shouted at Ken Livingstone after debate
pages.headline: Boris and Ken in furious swear lift row
pages.teaser: BORIS Johnson calls Ken Livingstone a 'liar' in foul-mouthed lift rant after first live debate ahead of London mayoral elections
pages.articlebody:
BORIS Johnson called Ken Livingstone a "f****** liar" as they travelled in a lift together after the first live debate ahead of next month's London mayoral elections.

The pair clashed furiously over their tax arrangements today in a fractious session hosted by LBC 97.3.

The row continued off-air when a furious Mr Johnson swore at his Labour opponent.

Travelling up to the roof terrace to be photographed, the Mayor shouted at Mr Livingstone: âItâs all f****** lies, itâs all f****** lies."

Liberal Democrat mayoral candidate Brian Paddick and Green party hopeful Jenny Jones, as well as LBC managing editor James Rea, were also in the lift when Mr Johnson turned on Mr Livingstone.

In the debate, Tory Mr Johnson denied suggestions he had used a company to channel his media earnings to avoid paying income tax — a claim that he has levelled at his Labour opponent.

Mr Livingstone accused the mayor of having âthe same arrangementsâ for dealing with his media earnings as he had, insisting he had used a company called Finland Station.

Mr Johnson called the claim âliesâ, adding: âI have never used a company to minimise my tax.

âThere was a TV production company which I was briefly a director of but I certainly never... I have always paid full income tax.â

A spokesman for Ken Livingstone said: âBoris Johnson lost his temper because he lost the debate — he talked about cable cars, not cutting fares and the squeeze on Londoners.â

During the debate Mr Livingstone was pressed by presenter Nick Ferrari about allegations that he had paid public money to the mother of one of his children while he was mayor of London.

But Mr Livingstone insisted he had ânever paid money to anyoneâ following claims that Jan Woolf was given Â£6,500 for helping to put together a show on slavery.

The Labour candidate, along with Lib Dem Brian Paddick and Jenny Jones for the Greens, rounded on Mr Johnson for his record on crime, high travel costs and cycling safety in the city.

At the end of the debate, the LBC 97.3 âTwitter juryâ put Ken Livingstone and Brian Paddick joint top on 24 per cent each, Boris Johnson on 16 per cent and Jenny Jones on 8 per cent.

video.caption: LIVINGSTONE under fire in Mayoral debate on Nick Ferrari's LBC radio show

image.caption: Blazing row ... Boris Johnson shouted at Ken Livingstone after debate

pages.subdeck: New arrival ... John meets his granddaughter Angelique, now five months
pages.headline: Sailor John spends record 14 years at sea
pages.teaser: JOHN, 49, has the record for logging more days at sea than any other serving sailor in the Royal Navy
pages.articlebody:
LOYAL John Wicking has logged more days at sea than any other serving sailor in the Royal Navy - equal to FOURTEEN years.

The 49-year-old signed up straight from school at the age of 16 and has been afloat for a total of 5,100 days.

He has visited more than 30 countries and served on ten submarines and five ships.

Over the years he has missed countless birthdays, anniversaries and other family landmarks — including the births of his two grandchildren.

But he still found time to have three kids with devoted wife Julie, 49.

John still has more than five years to go — putting him on course for a new record.

His remarkable achievement has been marked with a personal letter of thanks from the First Sea Lord, Admiral Sir Mark Stanhope.

He told the steadfast sailor he had clocked up the highest amount of days at sea by anyone in the Royal Navy.

Admiral Stanhope wrote: âMy very many congratulations on this remarkable achievement which is such an impressive testament to your character in continually opting for sea assignments rather than time ashore.

âI am immensely grateful for the service you have given the Royal Navy in both the submarine and surface flotillas.â

John, a leading logistician, said: âI will have spent 33 years in the Navy in July. I was 16 when I first joined.

âIâve only ever had one job and only ever applied for one job.

âI decided to join because I wanted to travel the world and I thought it would be a good life so my family were happy for me.

âIâm still enjoying it and have about five and a half years to go, but I havenât thought about the day when I have to leave the Navy.â

John is currently on shore leave after returning to Plymouth, Devon, following his latest six-month stint away in the Middle East with the frigate HMS Argyll.

During his absence his second grand-daughter Angelique, now five months, was born and he is meeting her for the first time.

Over the years John has met several members of the Royal family including the Queen, Prince Charles and Princess Anne.

He has served on subs HMS Repulse, HMS Renown, HMS Revenge, HMS Oracle, HMS Onslaught, HMS Trafalgar, HMS Talent, HMS Trenchant, HMS Splendid and HMS Sovereign.

His ships have been HMS Bulldog, HMS Ocean, HMS Campbelltown, HMS Bullwark and HMS Argyll.

John, from Plymstock, Devon, said the hardest part about being in the Navy was not being able to see his family — although email has made contact easier.

In 1986 his daughter Christyanne, now 26, was christened on board the submarine he was serving on.

He added: âItâs hard missing out on things while Iâm away — the kidsâ first birthdays, them going to school, leaving school and my grand-daughterâs birth.â

Wife Julie said: âWe got married in 1985 and I knew what his job was when I met him so I knew he would be away a lot.

âAll the time weâve been married Iâve never known any different, but itâs lovely when he comes back.

âWeâve been together so long that you get used to it. Itâs made the kids very self-sufficient.

âYou have to have a certain mentality to be able to cope.

âIâm so proud of him for breaking the record, but itâs been all of his own choosing — if he ever said to me tomorrow he wanted to leave the Navy thatâs fine.

âIâm just here for him to support him in whatever he decides to do.â

John said he was unaware he had broken the record until a friend looked it up for him.

He said: âI knew I was close to the record because I knew I was reaching 5,000 days and I didnât think there would be many people who had done that much.

âIt feels good to know Iâm the holder and Iâm excited to see if anyone else can break it, but I donât think they will.â

John now has a month off with his family and friends before his next deployment to the Falklands.

image.caption: New arrival ... John meets his granddaughter Angelique, now five months

pages.subdeck: Newlyweds ... George Galloway poses with new wife Putri Gayatri Pertiwi
pages.headline: George Galloway weds woman he has known six months
pages.teaser: MP who trounced Labour in Bradford by-election marries for a fourth time
pages.articlebody:
PARLIAMENTARY comeback kid âGorgeous Georgeâ Galloway has married for a FOURTH time — six months after meeting his new bride for the first time, it was reported today.

Fresh from thrashing Labour in the Bradford West by-election, the former pal of Iraqi tyrant Saddam Hussein flew to Amsterdam to marry a woman 30 years younger than him.

Galloway, 57, is said to have wed in a hotel less than 48 hours after bagging a seat in the Commons under the banner of his Respect party.

His marriage to 27-year-old anthropologist Putri Gayatri Pertiwi comes just four months after his third wife gave birth to their second son.

Putri is two years YOUNGER than his firstborn, Lucy.

He told the Daily Mail after it appeared on his Wikipedia site: âPutri is an anthropologist and child rights specialist and we have known each other for about six months.

âThe next few months will be interesting because I will be working back in Westminster as an MP. But we will be moving around between London, Bradford and Amsterdam.â

They are believed to have met through Gallowayâs âViva Palestinaâ charity.

When he sent out a victory tweet following last weekâs conquest, she faithfully re-tweeted the same words: âBy the Grace of God we have won the most sensational victory in British political history.â

Galloway earned his 'gorgeous' nickname after bragging about his sexual exploits on a holiday in Greece.

He was formerly MP for Glasgow Hillhead and Bethnal Green and Bow.

image.caption: Newlyweds ... George Galloway poses with new wife Putri Gayatri Pertiwi

article.caption: Galloway: Happy to be MP for Blackburn (Bradford actually, George)
Cat that creamed Labour

pages.subdeck: What a difference a week makes ... snow has replaced last week's sunny weather
pages.headline: Snow falls a week after record heatwave
pages.teaser: PARTS of Britain woke up to snow today as last week's scorching weather is replaced by wintry sub-zero temperatures
pages.articlebody:
PARTS of Britain woke up to a blanket of snow today as the recent scorching weather was replaced by wintry conditions and predictions of sub-zero temperatures.

Around seven inches of snow fell in Aviemore in the Highlands overnight as an Arctic weather front bore down on the UK.

And today nine hillwalkers, including six teenagers had to be rescued after becoming stranded in the treacherous conditions.

A major rescue operation was launched this morning after the party became stuck in the Cairngorms.

Around four hours after they were initially alerted, police confirmed that the entire group had been rescued successfully.

The wintry blast comes just a week after record-breaking warm temperatures in north-eastern Scotland.

Last Tuesday temperatures rose to 23.6C in Aboyne, Aberdeenshire, marking a new high in Scotland for the month.

Today the mercury dropped to minus 0.5C overnight and was at 0C at 6am.

The Met Office issued severe weather warnings for all of Scotland, as well as parts of northern England, Yorkshire and Humber, and the East Midlands.

The snow caused widespread travel chaos as temperatures plunged. Emergency services attend a seven-vehicle accident in Shotts, North Lanarkshire.

There were a number of other collisions and reports of cars sliding off the road in Tayside and Fife where some vehicles also became stuck in the snow in the Largoward and St Monans area.

Roads were closed in some areas due to the weather.

Around four inches (10cm) of snow has carpeted most parts of northern Scotland overnight, with 7.5 inches (17cm) recorded in Aviemore and temperatures of minus 2.7C in Glen Ogle.

Scotlandâs central belt was also hit by the wintry weather, which will gradually creep into northern England, parts of Wales and the Midlands in the coming 24 hours.

Scottish Transport Minister Keith Brown said: âThis kind of weather is much more normal for Scotland than the superb weather we have had over the previous days. So we have had, for example, 124 gritters out overnight.

âBecause weâve not had this kind of weather over previous weeks, it can catch people by surprise and what weâre saying is people should listen to the media, take on board any information theyâve got about the likely length of time to make their journeys and take the appropriate precautions.â

Forecasters predict that the snow will move south over the course of the day.

Top weather forecaster Aisling Creevy said: âA slow-moving Arctic front has brought a wintry mix of weather to parts of Scotland overnight with snow, sleet and rain in northern and central areas.

âSnow and rain showers will continue in Scotland throughout the day and move into northern England before reaching the Midlands tomorrow morning.

âTomorrow the UK will be noticeably colder and feeling quite raw and we could get widespread lows of around minus 5C in Scotland overnight.â

The weather is in stark contrast to Marchâs hot weather: the only years to have had a warmer month in the past 100 years are 1938, 1948, 1957, 1990 and 1997.

image.caption: What a difference a week makes ... snow has replaced last week's sunny weather

pages.subdeck: Appetite for love? ... Tian Tian, left, and Yang Guang
pages.headline: Eat, shoot and leave
pages.teaser: BRITAIN’S two giant pandas are set to meet for the first time in the hope they will mate
pages.articlebody:
BRITAINâS two giant pandas are set to meet for the first time in the hope they will mate.

But the male, called Yang Guang (Sunshine), will have to act fast.

Female pandas ovulate once a year â giving him a window of just 36 hours to score with Tian Tian (Sweetie).

Experts at Edinburgh Zoo plan to introduce the pair today or tomorrow.

The bamboo-chewing creatures will be moved into a ârustic roomâ out of public view where they will spend about 15 minutes together.

They will be watched through a grille by the zooâs conservation expert Iain Valentine and Chinese vet Dr Tang Chunxiang, who has flown in especially for the event.

The eight-year-old pandas will be introduced up to three times on the first day and another three on the second.

Pandas are notoriously reluctant to mate, but hopes are high as Sweetie has previously given birth to twins and Sunshine has fathered a child.

They have been kept side by side in separate enclosures since arriving in December on a ten-year loan from China.

Experts have stage managed a little foreplay for the pair by swapping their enclosures and said the results have been âpromisingâ. A zoo spokeswoman reported: âSweetie has been into his pen, covering herself in his hay and rubbing it all over her body.â

âMeanwhile Sunshine has been rolling around her enclosure, climbing trees, doing handstands and generally putting his scent everywhere.

âThere is really only two days for them to be together when she is particularly fertile.

âShe is 14 stone and he is 20 stone so they have to be watched carefully in case they do not get along.â

Mr Valentine said yesterday: âWe will be on hand to separate the bears if necessary.â

But he added: âIâm looking forward to the next few days with great anticipation.â

b.jackson@the-sun.co.uk

myView

By FIONA CELESTE, the UKâs only pet astrologer

BOTH pandas are Leos and this is the fire sign. This means they are both likely to be loyal and thatâs a good combination.

Going by the past ratio of births to pandas I understand itâs really hard to breed.

But I hope they do breed, it would be wonderful if there were babies on the way. I am very hopeful.

article.caption: Bark from the brink... Britain's rarest dog breed gets boost of 19 puppies
Panda-monium

caption.#: Talent like this is hard to find

image.caption: Appetite for love? ... Tian Tian, left, and Yang Guang

pages.subdeck: Car-copter ... the PAL-V can transform from a car into a gyrocopter in seconds
pages.headline: Boffins create incredible flying car-copter
pages.teaser: VIDEO: SEE amazing three-wheeled car turn itself into a gyrocopter and take to the air
pages.articlebody:
INVENTORS have high hopes for this car which can fly like a HELICOPTER.

The PAL-V, created by Dutch boffins, is actually a gyrocopter that creates lift through forward motion from a rotor on its back.

And, as it reaches speeds of up to 110mph it will have you to work in no time.

Unlike a lot of planes it only needs 540ft of runway to get off the ground and has a range of 315 miles.

It can match its air speed on the ground too. And crucially for an aircraft, the makers say it CANNOT stall.

PAL-V co-founder Robert Dingemanse said: âIf you want to fly over a mountain you can do that and then drive at the other end and go to your destination or fly over water or past a traffic jam of course.

"All those kind of things are possible now."

The design differs from that of the American Terrafugia which turns into a plane using fold-out wings.

The firm announced this week that it had completed its first test flight and aims to put the PAL-V on the market within a year. It is expected to cost Â£175,000.

article.caption: Souped-up Sinclair C5 is a monster trike
Flying car is 'road legal'
Mond-aero man

video.caption: DUTCH inventors keep their feet on the ground but have high hopes for PAL-V

image.caption: Car-copter ... the PAL-V can transform from a car into a gyrocopter in seconds

pages.subdeck: On ground ... couple's Cessna Chancellor
pages.headline: Woman, 80, lands plane after pilot husband passes out and dies
pages.teaser: SHE had no flying experience but managed to bring down the twin-engine aircraft safely
pages.articlebody:
AN 80-year-old woman with no flying experience incredibly managed to safely land a plane after her pilot husband passed out and died.

The unnamed American woman was forced into action after her husband, 81, collapsed while flying the eight-seater Cessna Chancellor.

She grabbed the controls of the twin-engine prop and called for help on the radio.

Air controllers attempted to talk her down but an hour into the crisis last night she started to run out of FUEL

A nearby airport then sent a second plane up to meet her and help coach her down.

Sheriff Terry Vogel said: "We got him up into an aircraft and he felt it was easier for him to give her instructions, for him to determine for instance, her speed in the air and how to instruct how to successfully land that aircraft.

"She's not a licensed pilot and has very little knowledge on flying an aircraft.

"We're very proud of her for doing what she did. It was a very difficult situation with her husband unconscious next to her. It took a lot to collect her thoughts and get that thing landed.â

The woman, from Wisconsin, escaped injury after a bumpy landing at the stateâs Door County Cherryland Airport despite her right engine losing power.

Her husband was pronounced dead once on the ground.

image.caption: On ground ... couple's Cessna Chancellor

pages.subdeck: Stepping down ... James Murdoch
pages.headline: James Murdoch resigns as chairman of BSkyB
pages.teaser: JAMES Murdoch is expected to stand down as chairman of satellite broadcaster BSkyB
pages.articlebody:
JAMES Murdoch today stepped down as chairman of BSkyB.

Mr Murdoch said he did not want his role to become a âlightning rodâ for the satellite broadcaster.

The deputy chief operating officer at News Corporation - BSkyBâs controlling shareholder and parent company of The Sun's publisher News International - will stay on the Sky board as a non-executive director.

He is replaced as chairman by his deputy, Nick Ferguson.

Mr Murdoch, 39, leaves weeks before a Government report is published into the News of the World, closed by NI last year. He is also expected to appear alongside his father Rupert, News Corp chief operating officer, at the Leveson Inquiry into newspaper practices.

His departure comes despite receiving backing from BSkyB shareholders who reappointed him at the companyâs annual general meeting last November. News Corp owns 39 per cent of BSkyB.

Mr Murdoch Jr said in a letter to the Department for Culture, Media and Sport Committee last month that he accepts his share of the blame for not uncovering phone hacking at the shut Sunday tabloid sooner but denied he had turned a âblind eyeâ to allegations of criminal wrongdoing.

He was appointed chairman of BSkyB in December 2007 after being its chief executive since February 2003.

He said today: âAs attention continues to be paid to past events at News International, I am determined that the interests of BSkyB should not be undermined by matters outside the scope of this company.

âI am aware that my role as chairman could become a lightning rod for BSkyB and I believe that my resignation will help to ensure that there is no false conflation with events at a separate organisation."

Tom Mockridge, chief executive of NI, will replace Mr Ferguson as deputy chairman.

image.caption: Stepping down ... James Murdoch

pages.subdeck: Attack ... Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner yesterday
pages.headline: War of words
pages.teaser: CRISTINA Fernández de Kirchner sullies a day of remembrance with insult
pages.byline: By GRAEME WILSON, Deputy Political Editor
pages.articlebody:
ARGENTINAâS president blasted Britainâs âridiculous and absurdâ stance on the Falklands last night as both countries marked the 30th anniversary of the start of the war between them.

Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner sullied a day of remembrance by accusing Britain of using its âcolonial enclaveâ to steal Argentinaâs oil and fish.

In a firebrand speech, she said: âEvery day that goes by it looks more ridiculous, more absurd to the eyes of the world. It is unjust that in the 21st century there are still colonial enclaves such as the one here.â

She attacked PM David Cameron, who vowed yesterday to defend the islandersâ right to remain British.

Mrs Kirchner said: âHow ridiculous to want to dominate a territory more than 14,000km away. The British Prime Minister said Argentine forces came to steal the islandersâ freedom. He is clearly not aware that back then the Argentine peopleâs freedom was also taken captive by the military junta.

âIt was a war pushed by a military coup â it was not the Argentine people who decided to go on to war.â

Mrs Kirchner claimed British rule over the Falklands was a threat to Argentinaâs ânatural resources â our fisheries, our oilâ.

She made her comments at a ceremony in Ushuaia, Tierra del Fuego, to remember the 649 Argentinian service personnel who died in the 1982 conflict. Mr Cameron issued a statement honouring the war dead of both sides â while praising the heroism of British forces who recaptured the Falklands at a cost of 255 lives.

He said: âThirty years ago today, the people of the Falkland Islands suffered an act of aggression that sought to rob them of their freedom and their way of life.

âToday is a day for commemoration and reflection, a day to remember all those who lost their lives.

âWe salute the heroism of the Task Force which set sail to free the islands. We are rightly proud of the role Britain played in righting a profound wrong. Britain remains staunchly committed to upholding the right of the Falkland Islanders to determine their own future.

âThat was the fundamental principle that was at stake 30 years ago, and that is the principle which we solemnly reaffirm today.â

Defence Secretary Philip Hammond dismissed claims that Britain could not defend the Falklands against another invasion.

He insisted: âWe will defend them robustly. We have the assets, the people, the equipment in place to do so.â

Meanwhile protesters clashed with riot police yesterday after trying to storm the British Embassy in Argentinaâs capital Buenos Aires.

Militants torched Union flags and an effigy of Prince William â who was posted to the islands as an RAF helicopter pilot in February.

The banner-waving crowd hurled firebombs at cops but were beaten back with water cannon and rubber bullets. Police restored barriers round the embassy as the protestors dispersed.

A similar mob attacked banks when William first arrived in the Falklands.

g.wilson@the-sun.co.uk

article.caption: 255 fallen honoured by heroes on Falklands War 30th anniversary
Argentina blasts UK on 30th anniversary of Falklands War
David Cameron vows to defend Falklanders’ right to stay British
We ran up that mountain with no body armour, no helmet, no compensation if we got hurt... but I’d do it again tomorrow
Falklands fears over Argie vets
Blockaded Falklands helped...by Uruguay

pages.subdeck: Transformation ... Michelle has now lost 15st thanks to surgery and exercise
pages.headline: 'Sleep disorder made me balloon to 27 stone'
pages.teaser: Michelle, 40, piled on lbs after sleep disorder stopped her breathing 666 times in 4 hours
pages.articlebody:
A MUM who ballooned to 27 stone as her breathing stopped every time she slept has been saved by a tummy tuck.

Michelle Shufflebotham suffered from sleep apnoea for 12 years — a disorder that causes muscles and soft tissue in her throat to collapse, cutting off her breathing for ten or more seconds at a time.

But Michelle, 40, did not know she had the condition, which disturbed her vital deep sleep and left her depressed, exhausted and piling on the pounds.

The hairdresser said: âI would just never sleep at night time, which meant I would doze off anywhere, anytime during the day.

âIt started when we went on holiday over ten years ago. I constantly felt tired, but didnât think it was anything serious.

âBut it got worse and worse, I had no energy and just piled on the weight.

âThe scariest point was falling asleep cutting a customerâs hair. It was awful. It would also happen in front of my friends.

âSometimes they would spray cold water in my face to wake me up. I was so embarrassed.â

She quit her job after the scissors incident. And her weight shot up so much she stopped leaving the house and gorged on takeaways because she was too tired to cook.

Mum-of-two Michelle — who would nod off about 20 times a day — was finally diagnosed after breaking down in tears during a visit to her GP.

She was told she had just one year to live. And doctors monitoring her breathing found it stopped 666 times in just four hours.

Her lungs contained 35 per cent of the oxygen they needed and Michelleâs Body Mass Index was 59 — obesity begins at 30.

Now, after a Â£9,000 op on the NHS, Michelle is back to a healthy 12st — and can enjoy a proper nightâs sleep.

Speaking of her ordeal, Michelle, from Stoke, Staffs, said: âI became a prisoner in my own home. I was just a recluse by the end; I was so big I couldnât do anything. My self-esteem was just so low, I would cry all the time.

âI would sit on a stool to do anything and didnât go up the stairs at home for years. If I needed anything, I would get the kids to go.

âTo do my washing I would wheel myself in a chair from the washing machine to the dryer. Walking a few paces was a nightmare.

âWhen they gave me a year to live I knew I had to have the operation.â

Now 15st lighter Michelle still keeps a pair of size-30 shorts in her wardrobe as a reminder of her former existence.

She says her children Jade, 19, and Carl, 17, have enjoyed seeing her change her habit of calling out for takeaways most nights of the week.

And husband Carl, 42 — who had also become overweight and was frustrated at having to do all of the familyâs shopping — must also be pleased.

Michelle admitted: âI was a bad yo-yo dieter. I would go to the slimming classes, lose a stone, then give up and gain three back on.

âAs a family weâre all now a lot healthier than we used to be. But I was just lazy. My friends never had the heart to say you need to do something.

âWhen my daughterâs friends saw me fall asleep and fall off the sofa they were in fits of laughter.

âGetting clothes to fit me was expensive and I lost so much pride in my appearance that I would slob round the house in a big nightie most of the day.

âIt was only when I went to my GP and burst into tears that we started to get the ball rolling to having the operation.â

Michelle now loves clothes shopping, going for nights out again and hitting the gym three times a week after the successful surgery.

She is also back cutting the hair of friends and family and hopes to return to full-time work at a salon soon.

image.caption: Transformation ... Michelle has now lost 15st thanks to surgery and exercise

pages.subdeck: 'Assault' ... cop allegedly kicked boy in police custody suite
pages.headline: Met police plunged into fresh race row
pages.teaser: OFFICER was allegedly caught on CCTV kicking and kneeing 15-year-old boy
pages.articlebody:
A COP has been accused of assaulting a black teenager during last year's London riots — plunging The Met into a fresh race row.

The officer was allegedly caught on CCTV kicking and kneeing the 15-year-old in an East London police station.

A Met Police spokesman said they are investigating an allegation of excessive force on a prisoner in the custody suite on August 11 last year.

The officer involved was put on restrictive duties while an Independent Police Complaints Commission (IPCC) investigation into the claims was carried out.

The Met have received the IPCC report and is now considering what disciplinary action to take.

The cop was also present only hours earlier when colleague PC Alex MacFarlane allegedly racially abused a 21-year-old black man.

MacFarlane has been suspended after reportedly being recorded on a mobile phone saying: "The problem with you is that you will always be a n*****, yeah?"

A third police officer present during the racial slur, who has not been named, is also being investigated but remains on full duty.

Commander Peter Spindler, of the Directorate of Professional Standards, said: "We are taking these allegations extremely seriously.

"Any use of racist language or excessive use of force is totally unacceptable; at the conclusion of any criminal proceedings we will instigate the appropriate internal action."

caption.#: Met suspends 'racist cop' over 'n***** insult' during riots

image.caption: 'Assault' ... cop allegedly kicked boy in police custody suite

pages.subdeck: 'In shock' ... Pentland Primary in Billingham, Teesside
pages.headline: Lunch killed girl, 6
pages.teaser: TEACHERS tried desperately to save little Chantelle Firth at Pentland Primary on Teesside
pages.articlebody:
A GIRL of six choked to death on her school lunch in front of horrified classmates.

Teachers tried desperately to save little Chantelle Firth.

She was rushed to hospital but doctors could not revive the youngster.

Cops are investigating the tragedy at Pentland Primary in Billingham, Teesside. Head Hazel Ducker said: âChantelle was a very popular girl.

âOur whole school community is devastated by the tragic loss of such a lovely, gentle and kind child. Pupils and staff are still in shock.â

Flowers were placed at the school gates and tributes were left online.

One Facebook message read: âWoke up wishing it was a bad dream but it ainât. Love you loads. RIP angel.â

An inquest was opened and adjourned. Her family are being comforted by specialist officers.

r.perrie@the-sun.co.uk

image.caption: 'In shock' ... Pentland Primary in Billingham, Teesside

pages.subdeck: Street Flighting Woman ... Polly the parrot
pages.headline: Parrot interrupts school by screeching Mick Jagger’s name
pages.teaser: ESCAPED bird causes chaos, sitting in playing fields calling out Rolling Stone’s name
pages.articlebody:
AN escaped parrot caused chaos at a school — loudly screeching the name of rock legend Mick Jagger from the playground.

Three-year-old African Grey Polly had managed to undo the string used to keep her cage door closed.

And after fleeing her owner's home in Newmarket, Suffolk, she settled down in trees outside nearby school Newmarket College.

The bird then interrupted lessons across the school by whistling and repeating the name of the 68-year-old Rolling Stones singer.

It took three hours before a caretaker eventually tempted Polly down using some fruit.

Owner Rod Suttle, who used to work at the school, said today he was amazed by his musical pet's vanishing act.

He explained: "I started to panic when she went missing â she was missing overnight.

"But weirdly she turned up at the school where I used to work â what are the chances of that?

"She is a really intelligent bird, has learnt to untie her own cage and she is always chatting away.

"She even makes the ringing noise of the telephone, pretends to answer the phone, and then has a conversation with herself. It is really quite funny."

But 67-year-old Rod said his bird's love for the Rolling Stones frontman comes as a surprise to him.

He added: "She was apparently chanting 'Mick Jagger' and disturbed all the school pupils.

"I have never taught her to say anything â and I certainly have not taught her to say 'Mick Jagger' â so it's rather a bizarre thing for her to chant."

article.caption: Let me go! Stolen parrot loves to sing Queen hits
Parrot loses feathers on beer and chips diet
A baby, an urn and a stuffed parrot left in hotels by Brits
Breeders 'sold sick monkey'
Boozing parrots get outta their tree

image.caption: Street Flighting Woman ... Polly the parrot

pages.subdeck: Strike threat ... Stansted Airport
pages.headline: Families breathe easy as Easter Stansted Airport strike is axed
pages.teaser: WALK-OUT by ground staff called off for now after peace talks over pay dispute
pages.articlebody:
THE Easter getaway at Stansted will go ahead unhindered after a strike by ground staff was called off following peace talks.

Members of the GMB union had voted to walk out for four hours on Good Friday, Saturday and Easter Monday, in a dispute over pay.

The move threatened travel chaos for families heading abroad for the school holidays.

The union had claimed Swissport employees faced cuts of up to Â£1,000 a year because of shift changes.

But today, following peace talks, the strike was suspended, though further talks will be held later this month.

Swissport said in a statement: âWe are pleased that passengers and families travelling over the Easter weekend will no longer face potential disruption.

âWe will continue our talks in an attempt to reach a joint consensus that ensures we understand our commercial challenges and balance the need for the work-life balance of our employees.â

image.caption: Strike threat ... Stansted Airport

pages.subdeck: Lager than life ... but superspy is ditching martini for beer
pages.headline: Daniel Craig is a bottle Bond
pages.teaser: STAR swaps martinis for lager as Heineken announces tie-in with 007 movie Skyfall
pages.articlebody:
JAMES Bond has a Brew to a Kill — as he will swap his dry martini for a BEER in the next 007 movie.

Daniel Craig, 44, will be seen swigging Dutch lager in at least one scene of Skyfall.

The spy's trademark "shaken, not stirred" tipple was sidelined as part of an adverising deal with brewers Heineken.

And Brit actor Craig will also star in a TV ad for the drink. It is directed by Fredrik Bond and is set to coincide with the release of the movie in October.

Craigâs face will also appear on bottles and other packaging.

The campaign marks the biggest collaboration between the movie franchise and the brand, which has had links for 15 years.

Heineken's Lesya Lysyj said: âBond is a perfect fit for us. He is the epitome of the man of the world."

pages.subdeck: Back in the running ... Jenna Talackova
pages.headline: Transgender model's beauty pageant comeback
pages.teaser: WOMAN axed for being born a man wins right to be re-entered in Miss Universe contest thanks to online support
pages.articlebody:
A TRANSGENDER model who was booted out of a Miss Universe competition for being born a man has won the right to re-enter the contest.

Curvy Jenna Talackova, 23, was disqualified from Miss Universe Canada last month when bosses discovered that she used to be a man.

But more than 25,000 people signed an online petition calling for her to be reinstated as a contestant.

Yesterday pageant bosses, The Miss Universe Organization, issued a statement saying that Jenna could compete as long as she meets "gender recognition requirements".

The body said: âThe Miss Universe Organization will allow Jenna Talackova to compete in the 2012 Miss Universe Canada pageant provided she meets the legal gender recognition requirements of Canada, and the standards established by other international competitions.â

The New York-based group did not specify which other competitionsâ standards Jenna would have to meet.

Jenna began hormone therapy at 14 and underwent gender reassignment surgery at 19, according to a 2010 interview posted on YouTube.

Yesterdayâs statement from the Miss Universe Organization overruled an earlier one from Miss Universe Canada, which said Jenna was eliminated as a finalist âbecause she did not meet the requirements to compete despite having stated otherwise on her entry formâ.

At the time, the national director of Miss Universe Canada told telly network CTV that each contestant must be a ânaturally born femaleâ.

image.caption: Back in the running ... Jenna Talackova

pages.subdeck: 'Inappropriate' ... wartime postcards mocking Hitler banned from collection
pages.headline: Royal Mail bans 'anti-German' postcard pics
pages.teaser: HISTORIC postcard cartoons poking fun at Hitler during the war have been banned — for being anti-German
pages.articlebody:
HISTORIC seaside postcards poking fun at Hitler, Goering and the Kaiser have been banned from Royal Mail limited edition stamps — for being anti-German.

The two cartoons were passed by British censors during the two World Wars.

But when saucy postcard company Bamforths selected them for a set of ten stamps, Royal Mail bureaucrats turned them down as âinappropriateâ.

The killjoys also rejected another five of the firmâs traditional seaside cards because they featured scantily-clad ladies or saucy jokes.

Bamforths drew up the plan for the stamps to celebrate 140 years since it was founded in Holmfirth, West Yorkshire.

The ten images were to appear on 200 âSmiler Sheetsâ which are produced by the Royal Mail to allow businesses to add an image to official stamps.

The stamps peel off and could be used to post letters but are usually traded between collectors.

Bamforths managing director Ian Wallace said they had chosen ten cards carefully to mark particular periods in the companyâs history.

One of the ten showed Hitler poking his head out of a dustbin to ask âHave those naughty bombers gone, Herman?â while Goering cowers in another bin with a medal stuck to his backside.

A First World War card shows a British Tommy chasing the Kaiser with a bayonet with a caption saying: âItâs LEAP year, and we mean to drive the point home to the Germans."

In its heyday Bamforths sold 30million cards a year.

Mr Wallace said: âWe airbrushed the swastikas out the Hitler one and they still turned it down.

âThe official at the Royal Mailâs offices told us we couldnât have them because they are anti-Germanic.

âI said âOf course, itâs anti-Germanic. There was a bloody war onâ. Are we supposed to airbrush out two World Wars as well?

âFor well over a century, Royal Mail, the GPO and post office have made a fortune from delivering the very postcards that some small-minded person or people have decided to censor.

âThe Bamforths sense of fun is appreciated all over the world but not apparently by a small number of people."

Philip Parker, head of stamp strategy, said: âRoyal Mail has very clear guidelines and policies on what it may accept for reproduction on this product range.

âRoyal Mail reserves the right to decline to print a customised sheet if we believe the content could be perceived as inappropriate or incompatible with our stamps.â

Bamforths has protested to PM David Cameron about the ban — without success.

Mike Whitehead, shareholder executive with the Department of Business, Innovation and Skill, replied on Mr Cameronâs behalf saying: âI have contacted Royal Mail about Bamforths' case and I understand they do have a number of restrictions on images which can be used in business customised sheets.

âThe restrictions are issues like offensive material of a sexual nature or the stereotyping of particular groups like women or racial minorities.â

Mr Wallace added: âIt is stalemate at the moment - but we are not giving in.â

image.caption: 'Inappropriate' ... wartime postcards mocking Hitler banned from collection

pages.subdeck: Swiped ... squirrel makes off with Snickers
pages.headline: Cheeky squirrel is nuts about Snickers
pages.teaser: CUTE snaps capture moment animal tried to steal snack from a wildlife photographer
pages.articlebody:
THESE cute snaps capture the moment a cheeky squirrel tried to get its paws on a photographer's chocolate bar.

The fact the Snickers was almost half the size of the furry critter did not put the ambitious animal off.

Snapper Tom Whetton was taking pictures of exotic birds at the Madera Canyon in Arizona, US, when the squirrel swiped his snack.

Tom, 65, said: âMy equipment was set up about 15 yards from where the birds hang out and I was enjoying a pleasant morning photographing them.

âAfter about three hours I picked up my tripod and camera and walked about ten feet from my chair, looking for a different angle.

"When I looked back at my chair I saw the squirrel approaching it before grabbing my Snickers bar."

Quick-thinking Tom managed to take these pictures of the hungry creature as it tried to tuck into his chocolate.

He added: âI quickly turned my camera around and started taking pictures.

âAt first he tried to bite the wrapping. He could probably smell nuts through the plastic.

âThen when he realised it was going to take him some time to get the wrapping off, he ran off towards the nearest tree.â

pages.subdeck: April Fool ... an Israeli Saar-5 class Corvette
pages.headline: Israeli sailors forced to walk the prank as April Fool backfires
pages.teaser: DAMP squib as head of the navy's 'joke' sails too close to the wind for general ranks
pages.articlebody:
SAILORS walked the prank as an April Foolsâ day joke spectacularly backfired in the Israeli military.

The country's naval commander wanted to wind his officers up so told them to prepare for a surprise ten-day exercise starting Sunday.

They were sworn to secrecy about the Mediterranean operation - but the orders trickled down to junior ranks.

Vice-Admiral Ram Rotenberg was only appointed head of the navy last June.

But his undoing was settled after crews worked through the night fuelling, rigging and preparing three missile ships on Saturday night expecting to sail to the Italian coast off Naples the next day.

Their families are also furious - after they began the usual ritual of sending money and food parcels to sustain loved ones while they were away.

One parent told an Israeli website: âSome of the parents were already en route to bring additional equipment and food for the soldiers and others had transferred cash into their accounts in case they would need funds in Italy.

âThe naval commander has nothing better to do than to carry out pranks?"

The Israel Defence Forces said the joke was "inappropriate".

image.caption: April Fool ... an Israeli Saar-5 class Corvette

pages.subdeck: Soaring ... internet advertising saw a huge increase last year
pages.headline: Online advertising spend soars to record high
pages.teaser: ADVERTISING online increased by 14.4% to a new high of £4.8billion in 2011
pages.articlebody:
ONLINE advertising soared to a record high of Â£4.8billion in 2011, according to a new report.

Spending on web ads was up Â£687million year on year — a bumper 14.4 per cent rise.

A study by the Internet Advertising Bureau UK conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers revealed it was the largest increase in five years.

Video ads saw a huge growth and now account for ten per cent of all online display advertising.

Expenditure on online video doubled to Â£109million from Â£54million in 2010. In 2008 the video spend was just Â£12million.

Advertising on mobile devices also rose by a whopping 157 per cent in 2011, to a new high of Â£203million.

The increase was attributed to the rise in smartphone ownership and soaring tablet sales.

The finance sector spent the most on ads, ahead of fast-moving consumer goods then retail, followed by entertainment and the media, then technology.

Tim Elkington, director of research and strategy at the IAB, said: âOnline and mobile advertising have experienced staggering growth since this study began in 1997.

âAdvertisers increasingly recognise the central role that online plays in their marketing campaigns.â

image.caption: Soaring ... internet advertising saw a huge increase last year

pages.subdeck: Natural X-ray ... shot of a transparent glass frog
pages.headline: Leaf frog
pages.teaser: AMPHIBIAN shot looks like an X-ray thanks to the photographer's clever use of light
pages.articlebody:
THIS see-through frog looks a little over exposed in an unbeLEAFable photo.

The amphibian appears as if itâs been X-rayed thanks to a photographerâs clever use of light.

The shadow of the amphibianâs eyes can be seen, as well as the markings of hundreds of spots that form its camouflage.

When seen under regular conditions the tiny Hyalinobatrachium valerioi frog has large yellow round spots and small black ones on its skin.

Portuguese photographer Luis Louro waited for SIX hours in Costa Rica to catch the picture using a backlight through the leaf to create the unusual image.

Like other glass frogs, in daylight its red heart and red and white coat containing its liver and digestive system are completely visible.

But few pictures have yet been able to look through the creature like an x-ray.

Luis said: âI used backlight to capture this transparent frog and I was really glad the wait was worth it.

âAs I spotted the frog I took a few quick shots as it didnât run, because they usually do.

âEvery time I plan a trip to the tropics I always search for frog locations first because they are great to photograph.

âWhen I made my journeys across Latin America, I took images of all kind of wildlife but my preference is always to small creatures like these.

âFrogs are wonderful animals.â

image.caption: Natural X-ray ... shot of a transparent glass frog

pages.subdeck: Heartbreak ... Adele
pages.headline: Someone Like Him - lost love behind Adele mega hits revealed
pages.teaser: FORMER lover who inspired singer's mega-hits on the album 21 is tour photographer Alex, 31
pages.articlebody:
THE man behind the love songs on Adeleâs albums has been revealed as photographer Alex Sturrock, a celebrity magazine has claimed.

The heartbroken singer wrote the hit album in the wake of a break-up with the mystery man she called, âthe love of my lifeâ.

But she has kept his identity hidden, despite fans' attempts to unearth the secret.

Now Heat magazine has claimed the Someone Like You is the 31-year-old snapper, who she is thought to have dated between then summer of 2008 and April 2009.

A friend of Alex told the mag: âIt was an intense period for them.

âThey met through mutual friends and hit it off straight away. He shot her a few times and that was just it.

âThey spent all their time together â and when they werenât together they would ring each other constantly.â

As the relationship blossomed, Adele gave Alex a job as the official photographer on her US tour and, according to the source, shared hotel rooms with him wherever they went.

He was also there to record the moment when she had her surprise Grammy win in February 2009.

The friend said: âHeâs a very normal guy and theyâd laugh a lot together, eat junk food and ignore the fact that her career was about to go stratospheric.

âAdele relied on him a lot, he was her best mate as well as her boyfriend and he was very protective of her.

âHeâd say no one knew her like he did.â

The unnamed pal claimed Alec refused to call the singer his âgirlfriendâ even though he was living at her house in Shepherdâs Bush, West London and added: âAdele was pretty hurt by that, but Alex didnât want to label what they had.â

Adele, 23, began writing the album after they split in 2009.

She later revealed: âI expected too much. I was needy, I was jealous even though Iâm not a jealous person.â

Although she has never named her former lover before she has talked about the split, saying that the huge hit, Someone Like You, summed up the relationship.

She said: âI was feeling pretty miserable and pretty lonely. I was on my knees really.â

Adele, who is now dating charity boss Simon Konecki, has recently admitted she has reconciled with her ex.

She said: âWeâre becoming friends again. Itâs alright. I know what I'm doing. Enough time has gone by.â

The singer was not available for comment.

pages.subdeck: Oni-on top form ... Kelly Brook
pages.headline: Kelly Brook veges out in New York
pages.teaser: MODEL dons onion-print frock as she watches Thom Evans on fashion show catwalk
pages.articlebody:
KELLY Brook cuts an eye-watering sight in an onion-print dress.

The busty model is the latest star to jump on the fruit and veg-themed frock bandwagon, donning a tasty number for a New York fashion show.

Kelly, 32, was in the Big Apple to support her boyfriend Thom Evans, who was on the catwalk at the From Scotland With Love exhibition.

The former Scottish rugby international strut his stuff on the runway in a kilt and nothing up top, parading the buff physique that surely helped woo the brunette beauty.

Later on, Thom, 26, covered up again to pose with his missus at the event.

Last month, Pixie Lott turned heads in a gown emblazoned with aubergines at the premiere of The Pirates! In An Adventure With Scientists! In London.

Meanwhile, Kelly has revealed sheâs ready to try for another baby, following her miscarriage heartache last May.

The actress was five months pregnant with Thomâs baby at the time of the tragedy â and Kelly insists losing her baby made her change her lifestyle.

She explained: âBefore I fell pregnant, Iâd been living the life of a 22-year-old â going to clubs and flying to a different country every two weeks.

âWhen I fell pregnant, I thought I could do what I wanted, but my body let me know that wasnât the case. When I miscarried, I was devastated.

âIt was the hardest lesson but, ultimately, a good one.

âSince the miscarriage, Iâve changed dramatically. Iâve reduced my workload, Iâm eating more healthily and exercising more.â

pages.subdeck: Pals ... Balotelli and Drake enjoyed dinner after trip to Etihad
pages.headline: Mario Balotelli’s Rih-lly keen on Drake
pages.teaser: MANCHESTER City ace takes rapper out for a curry after he watched him in action against Sunderland
pages.articlebody:
MANCHESTER City star Mario Balotelli has a new celebrity pal - Rihanna's ex Drake.

Mario, whoâs a huge hip-hop fan, invited the 25-year-old rapper, who enjoyed a short-lived fling with Rih in 2009, to watch him in action against Sunderland after hearing he was in Manchester for a gig.

And after his teamâs 3-3 draw on Saturday, Mario treated Drake to a curry in the city centre.

Drake paid tribute to Mario at his gig at the MEN Arena on Sunday, describing him as a ânew family memberâ.

He told the audience: âNo matter what team heâs in, heâs an amazing footballer.â

Mario had allowed Drake to use his executive box at Cityâs Etihad Stadium to watch the game.

And Drake later posted a photograph on Facebook page We Are Business, showing him sitting inside the stadium and wearing a City jacket.

City manager Roberto Mancini, who said recently he doesnât âtrustâ Balotelli, will be pleased to hear the player stayed away from Drakeâs official after party at the Bijou Club, which was attended by Coronation Street star Ryan Thomas and QPR player Shaun Wright-Philips.

Bijou boss Damien Matto said Drake loved the club and the atmosphere had been âfantasticâ.

Balotelli has attracted a number of other celebrity pals in recent months, including Noel Gallagher and The Only Way Is Essex hunk Mario Falcone.

pages.subdeck: Steamy ... Jennifer Lopez and Casper Smart
pages.headline: J-Lo gets Smart in a sexy clinch
pages.teaser: AMERICAN Idol judge wraps round boyfriend Casper's naked torso in saucy pics from new video
pages.articlebody:
JENNIFER Lopez drapes herself over her blindfolded toyboy Casper Smart in steamy pics from her new video.

The American Idol judge, who has been dating the 24-year-old dancer since Christmas, also places a manicured hand on his six pack in the Dance Again promo.

The tables are turned in another picture which sees the 42-year-old singer wearing the blindfold, printed with the words âLove is blind.â

And her sparkling top and shorts combo shows off her taut and tanned midriff as Casper ties the knot behind her head.

The saucy video is not the first time she had mixed business with pleasure.

Ten years ago her Jenny From The Block video saw her cavorting with actor Ben Affleck, her fiance at the time.

The mum-of-two, who had twins Max and Emme in February 2008, split from singer Marc Anthony in July after seven years of marriage.

She met the dancer Casper, whose nickname is Beau, at the end of last year and in January, she said she was unsure about walking down the aisle again.

She said: âIt's not time to think about that yet. It's still fresh.â

Although he is 18 years younger than his new love, he has insisted that the age gap is no obstacle to their relationship because their âhearts are endless and our souls infinite.â

He said: âAge, status, opinions of others are irrelevant. Ages are mere reminders of the hours logged on this earth and the precious time remaining.â

And as long as she looks that good, he wonât need the blindfold either.

THE Spice Girls musical is being delayed because of arguments between Mel B and Mel C.

The pair are wrangling over details for Viva Forever and are holding up writer Jennifer Saunders, claim US reports.

Emma Bunton, Victoria Beckham, Geri Halliwell, Melanie Brown and Melanie Chisholm are all involved in the project, but will not star in it.
